general_info.summary: The provided text lists several distinct topics, likely from a menu or a list of announcements. It includes information related to COVID-19 updates, two campuses of Sharda University (in Uzbekistan and Agra), academic offerings such as courses on ethics and an international credit transfer program, and a link to the National Cyber Crime Reporting Portal.
general_info.raw_content:
• Covid 19 Updates
• Sharda University Uzbekistan
• Sharda University Agra
• Courses on Human Values and Professional ethics
• National Cyber Crime Reporting Portal
• International Credit Transfer Programme

academicPrograms.programName: Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence (MSAI)

eligibilityCriteria: Hold a Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution
Minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
Strong background in computer science or a related quantitative field
Proficiency in programming (Python, Java, or C++) is highly recommended
requiredDocuments: Official transcripts from all previously attended universities
For international applicants: TOEFL or IELTS scores (minimum TOEFL iBT 90, IELTS 6.5)

academicPrograms.programName: Doctor of Philosophy in Biomedical Engineering (PhD BME)

eligibilityCriteria: Possess a Master's degree in Biomedical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related scientific discipline
Exceptional candidates with only a Bachelor's degree (minimum GPA 3.5) and significant research experience may be considered
Prior research publication is a significant advantage
requiredDocuments: Official transcripts of all graduate and undergraduate work
Three letters of recommendation from academic or research supervisors
Portfolio of any relevant publications or presentations
Personal interview may be required for shortlisted candidates
For international applicants: TOEFL iBT score of 100 or an IELTS score of 7.0

academicPrograms.programName: Bachelor of Arts in Literature (BA Lit)

eligibilityCriteria: Successfully completed high school or equivalent secondary education
Strong academic record in English, History, or Arts subjects is preferred
Minimum cumulative high school GPA of 2.5
SAT/ACT scores are not required, but can be submitted if available
requiredDocuments: Personal essay (250-500 words) discussing your interest in literature
One letter of recommendation from a teacher or guidance counselor
For international students: Demonstration of English proficiency through TOEFL (iBT 80) or IELTS (6.0), or by completing an English preparatory program
